**Cypher Representation (single‑line)**  

```cypher
CREATE
  (csp:CSP {component_id:'1', name:'CloudProvider'}),
  (vm1:Virtual {component_id:'2', name:'VM1', secondary_label:'VM'}),
  (vm2:Virtual {component_id:'3', name:'VM2', secondary_label:'VM'}),
  (vm3:Virtual {component_id:'4', name:'VM3', secondary_label:'VM'}),
  (os1:SystemLayer {component_id:'5', name:'OS_VM1', secondary_label:'OS'}),
  (os2:SystemLayer {component_id:'6', name:'OS_VM2', secondary_label:'OS'}),
  (os3:SystemLayer {component_id:'7', name:'OS_VM3', secondary_label:'OS'}),
  (apache:Service {component_id:'8', name:'Apache', secondary_label:'Server'}),
  (wp:Service {component_id:'9', name:'WordPress', secondary_label:'App'}),
  (mysql:Service {component_id:'10', name:'MySQL', secondary_label:'Server'}),
  (lb:Service {component_id:'11', name:'LoadBalancer', secondary_label:'App'}),
  (client:Party {component_id:'12', name:'Client', secondary_label:'Human'}),
  (lan:Network {component_id:'13', name:'LAN', secondary_label:'LAN'}),
  (csp)-[:provides]->(vm1),
  (csp)-[:provides]->(vm2),
  (csp)-[:provides]->(vm3),
  (vm1)-[:hosts]->(os1),
  (vm2)-[:hosts]->(os2),
  (vm3)-[:hosts]->(os3),
  (os1)-[:hosts]->(apache),
  (os1)-[:hosts]->(wp),
  (os2)-[:hosts]->(mysql),
  (os3)-[:hosts]->(lb),
  (wp)-[:uses]->(mysql),
  (lb)-[:uses]->(wp),
  (client)-[:interacts]->(lb),
  (lan)-[:connects]->(vm1),
  (lan)-[:connects]->(vm2),
  (lan)-[:connects]->(vm3);
```

This model satisfies all MACM database constraints, has a fully connected graph, and accurately represents the described WordPress deployment.

summary.name: Required node properties
summary.short: All nodes must have component_id (numeric string >0), primary_label (string), and type (string). Validate properties before insertion.

summary.name: Asset type validity
summary.short: Primary label must match node type prefix; secondary labels must follow predefined mappings (e.g., HW.Server needs [HW, Server] labels).

summary.name: Single hosting per asset
summary.short: Each asset can have at most one incoming hosts/provides relationship. Remove duplicate hosts if multiple exist.

summary.name: Mandatory host for Service
summary.short: Each Service must have exactly one incoming hosts/provides relationship (from SystemLayer/Virtual/Service or CSP).

summary.name: Alternate path for uses
summary.short: For every (A)-[:uses]->(B) there must exist an alternate path via hosts/provides/connects (not uses). Ensure infrastructure connectivity.

summary.name: SystemLayer -> SystemLayer hosting
summary.short: Only SystemLayer.OS may host SystemLayer.ContainerRuntime or SystemLayer.HyperVisor. Virtualization layers require an OS.

summary.name: SystemLayer -> Virtual hosting
summary.short: ContainerRuntime hosts Virtual.Container; HyperVisor hosts Virtual.VM. Match virtualization technology types.

summary.name: SystemLayer -> Service hosting
summary.short: Only SystemLayer.Firmware and SystemLayer.OS may directly host Services. Use Virtual nodes for containerized services.

summary.name: Virtual -> SystemLayer hosting
summary.short: Virtual nodes may only host base SystemLayer (OS or Firmware). VMs typically host an OS which then hosts services.

summary.name: HW -> SystemLayer restrictions
summary.short: Hardware cannot directly host SystemLayer.ContainerRuntime; an OS must mediate (HW->OS->ContainerRuntime layering).

summary.name: Graph connectivity
summary.short: Model must be connected: all nodes reachable in undirected graph. Link isolated components with appropriate relationships.

summary.name: Mandatory host for SystemLayer
summary.short: Each SystemLayer must have exactly one incoming hosts/provides. OS hosted by HW/Virtual; ContainerRuntime/HyperVisor by OS.

summary.name: Mandatory host for Virtual
summary.short: Each Virtual node must have at least one incoming hosts/provides (from ContainerRuntime/HyperVisor or CSP). Virtual resources require infrastructure.

summary.name: Hosts acyclicity
summary.short: The hosts hierarchy must be acyclic (no circular containment). Use [:uses] for dependencies, [:hosts] for containment only.

summary.name: Relationship pattern validity
summary.short: Only allowed patterns between primary labels are permitted: Party-interacts-*, Service-uses-Service/Virtual, SystemLayer-hosts-*, HW-hosts-HW/SystemLayer, CSP-provides-*, Network-connects-*.

result.description: A user or external actor interacting with the system.
A legally recognized individual or organization with rights and obligations.
A collection of related entities or individuals acting as a unified organizational unit.
A service provider offering communication network connectivity.
A Multi-Access Edge Computing device that processes data near the user.
A physical enclosure housing hardware components like servers or network devices.
A ground control station for managing remote devices or drones.
Interface for human interaction with a device through input and output mechanisms.
An Internet of Things device with connectivity and automation capabilities.
Device that connects IoT devices to external networks, handling protocol translation, aggregation, and preliminary data processing.
A physical network device that forwards data packets between different networks, directing traffic based on IP addresses.
A general-purpose hardware device used in various technological contexts.
A hardware system providing computing and storage services.
A user equipment device, such as a smartphone.
A small integrated circuit used to control embedded systems.
A System-on-Chip integrating multiple hardware components into a single circuit.
A low-cost microcomputer used for development and automation.
A personal computer used for local or network-based tasks.
A server node handling user login management in a computing cluster.
A data storage disk used in servers or networked systems.
A scheduler node managing workload distribution in a cluster.
A compute node used for processing in a cluster environment.
A generic Network.
A wide-area network connecting multiple locations or regions.
A local area network that enables communication between devices within a limited geographic area, such as a home or data center.
A wired local area network using physical connections.
A wireless local area network (WiFi) for device connectivity.
A virtual network created by the container runtime to enable isolated communication between containers and with the host system.
A personal area network for short-range communication, such as wearables.
Radio network infrastructure enabling wireless communication between user devices and core networks.
The core infrastructure of a 5G network for managing data traffic.
An operating system managing hardware and software resources.
A firmware service that controls low-level hardware functions.
Software or firmware layer that creates and manages virtual machines by abstracting and allocating physical hardware resources.
Software component that manages the lifecycle and execution of containers on a host system.
A virtual machine service used in different infrastructure.
Application service running in an isolated, portable, and scalable container environment.
A generic Service.
Logical service managing radio access functionalities and control over the RAN infrastructure.
A 5G service managing user registration and mobility (AMF).
A 5G service handling authentication and security (AUSF).
A 5G service exposing network functions to applications (NEF).
A 5G service acting as the network function repository (NRF).
A 5G service managing network slicing (NSSF).
A 5G service providing network analytics (NWDAF).
A 5G policy control service (PCF).
A 5G service handling user data management (UDM).
A 5G service managing packet forwarding (UPF).
A general-purpose application service that consumes data, interfaces with other services, or presents information to end users.
A web browser service enabling internet navigation.
A service that enables secure remote access and command execution over the SSH protocol.
A database service for storing and managing structured data.
A web service hosting websites and applications.
Interface that exposes functionalities of a service to other components or systems via defined protocols.
A NoSQL database service for handling non-relational data.
Provides authentication and identity management services, enabling user verification and access control.
An MQTT broker service for IoT device communication.
A service that maps RPC program numbers to network addresses, enabling RPC clients to locate available services on a host.
A job scheduling service for managing automated tasks.
An MQTT client service for IoT device communication.

result: uses: Functional dependency between services/systems, requires alternate path without uses/interacts
hosts: Hosting/deployment relation, constrained by SystemLayer/Virtual/HW rules
provides: CSP provides services, resources, networks, or hardware
connects: Connectivity relation, can include protocol info
interacts: Interaction relation, usually between Party and other assets
